recipeIngredients.display: ¹/₂ lemon Juice, optional, to finish

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 200°C.
Cut the cauliflower into medium florets.
Slice the onion into half-moons and the peppers into wide strips.
Place everything in a large baking tray. Add the garlic, olive oil, and seasonings.
Mix well to coat all the vegetables.
Bake for 25-35 minutes, stirring halfway through, until golden and tender at the edges.
Finish with a few drops of lemon juice and, if desired, fresh parsley or crumbled feta cheese.

items.name: Chicken Fillets Rolled with Olives
items.description: A simple and succulent recipe full of flavour, ideal for a delightful meal.

recipeIngredients.display: ¹/₂ cup white wine optional, but recommended

recipeInstructions.text: Season the fillets with salt, pepper, garlic, oregano, and paprika. Let them rest for 15-30 minutes to develop flavour.
Slice the olives into rounds (or keep whole if you prefer more texture).
Place some olives on each fillet and roll tightly. Secure with toothpicks.
Heat the olive oil in a pan over medium heat. Place the rolls with the seam side down first. Brown well on all sides (about 8-10 minutes total).
If using white wine, add to the pan, cover, and cook for another 5 minutes until the chicken is well cooked and succulent. Let the sauce reduce slightly before serving.

items.name: Simple Grilled Hake
items.description: A simple and delicious grilled hake recipe.

recipeIngredients.display: Optional: herbs (parsley, coriander, thyme, or rosemary)

recipeInstructions.text: Season the fish with salt, pepper, garlic, and lemon juice. Let it rest for 10–15 minutes.
Heat a frying pan or grill well and drizzle with olive oil.
Place the hake and grill on medium heat for about 3–4 minutes on each side, until golden and tender.
Finish with a drizzle of olive oil and fresh herbs, if desired.

items.name: Quick Sautéed Vegetables (Frying Pan)
items.description: A simple and quick recipe for sautéed vegetables, perfect as a side dish or base for dishes.

recipeInstructions.text: Cut vegetables – 3 to 5 min
Heat the frying pan + olive oil – 1 min on medium-high heat.
Sauté the aubergine – 5 to 6 min alone in the pan, stir occasionally until golden and soft.
Add courgettes + pepper – 4 to 5 min, keep on medium-high heat until soft but still firm.
Season and finish – 1 min with salt, pepper, garlic/herbs. If desired, a dash of lemon at the end.

items.name: Cabbage Wraps with Chicken, Vegetables, Olives, and Peppers
items.description: A delicious recipe for cabbage wraps filled with chicken, vegetables, olives, and peppers. Ideal for dinner.

recipeIngredients.display: 2 chicken breasts cooked and shredded (or minced chicken)
¹/₂ green or yellow pepper diced
2 tablespoons creams or 3 tablespoons of cream cheese

recipeInstructions.text: Separate the leaves of the savoy cabbage and blanch them in boiling salted water for 2-3 minutes until soft. Remove and drain.
In a pot or wide pan, heat the olive oil and sauté the leek (or onion).
Add the carrot, peppers, and let soften.
Add the shredded chicken and olives.
Season with salt, pepper, and a touch of nutmeg.
Fold in the cream or cream cheese and turn off the heat.
Place a portion of filling in the centre of each cabbage leaf and roll it up to form a wrap.
Oven option (recommended): Place the wraps on a tray, sprinkle with grated cheese, and bake at 180°C for 15-20 minutes.
Pan option: Place the wraps in a large pot, add some water or stock, cover, and let cook for 10 minutes.

items.name: Chicken Breast Stuffed with Cheese and Cherry Tomatoes
items.description: A delicious dish featuring chicken breasts stuffed with cheese and cherry tomatoes, perfect for 2-3 people.

recipeIngredients.display: 100 grams mozzarellas sliced or 40-50 g grated parmesan
¹/₂ lemon Juice or balsamic vinegar

recipeInstructions.text: Make a lateral cut in each breast (like a book) without completely separating. Season inside and out with salt, pepper, and lemon.
With mozzarella: place slices inside the chicken (you can add a basil leaf).
With parmesan: sprinkle the inside with grated cheese (gives a more intense and dry flavour). Close and secure with toothpicks if needed.
Place the chicken on the tray, add the cherry tomatoes, garlic, herbs and drizzle with olive oil.
Bake in preheated oven at 190 °C for 30 minutes, basting halfway through.
Grill for 3–5 minutes at the end to brown (especially good with parmesan).

items.name: Sautéed Aubergine in Frying Pan/Wok
items.description: A delicious sautéed aubergine dish with garlic and spices.

recipeIngredients.display: 1 teaspoon paprika or sweet pepper optional
1 tablespoon soy sauce optional, but gives a great touch
Fresh or dried herbs (oregano, thyme or basil – optional)

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the aubergine. Wash the aubergine and cut it into cubes or half-moons. (Optional: sprinkle with salt and let it rest for 10 minutes; then dry with paper – this makes it less bitter and absorbs less oil.)
Heat the frying pan/wok. Heat the olive oil over medium-high heat.
Sauté. Add the aubergine and let it brown without stirring too much in the first few minutes. Keep turning until soft inside and golden outside (8-10 minutes).
Season. Add the garlic, salt, pepper, and paprika. Stir for 1 minute (careful not to burn the garlic).
Finish. Add the soy sauce and herbs. Sauté for another 30 seconds and it's ready.

items.name: Healthy Herb-Crusted Fish Fillets
items.description: A healthy recipe for fish fillets with a herb crust.

recipeIngredients.display: Fresh or dried herbs (parsley, coriander, thyme, oregano)
1 clove garlic small, finely chopped, optional

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 190 °C.
Mix the wholemeal breadcrumbs (or oatmeal), olive oil, herbs, garlic, and lemon zest.
Season the fillets with salt and pepper and place them on a baking tray lined with parchment paper.
Cover each fillet with the crust mixture, pressing lightly.
Bake for 15–20 minutes, until the fish is cooked and the crust is golden.

items.name: Sautéed 'Umami' Mushrooms in a Wok
items.description: A delicious umami-flavoured sautéed mushroom dish prepared using a wok.

recipeIngredients.display: 300 grams mushrooms shiitake, paris, portobello or mixed
1 tablespoon olive oil plus 1 teaspoon of butter

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the mushrooms: Clean with paper (do not wash, if possible). Cut into large pieces – they shrink.
Very hot pan: Wok or large frying pan, high heat. Only add the olive oil and wait for it to heat well.
Seal without stirring: Add the mushrooms and do not stir for 1–2 minutes. This creates a golden colour and prevents them from releasing too much water.
Flavour time: Stir, add the garlic and butter. Sauté for 1 more minute.
Umami finish: Add the shoyu (just a little!), balsamic/lemon and pepper. Throw in the herbs and stir.

items.name: Umami Stir-Fried Mushrooms in a Wok
items.description: A savoury stir-fried mushroom dish with an umami flavour.

recipeIngredients.display: 300–400 g of mushrooms (shiitake, button, portobello or mixed)
1 tablespoon of olive oil + 1 teaspoon of butter
1 teaspoon of balsamic vinegar or lemon

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the mushrooms. Clean with paper (do not wash, if possible). Cut into large pieces—they shrink.
Get the pan very hot. Use a wok or wide frying pan on high heat. Add only the olive oil and wait until it heats well.
Sear without stirring. Add the mushrooms and do not stir for 1–2 minutes. This creates a golden colour and prevents them from releasing too much water.
Time for flavour. Stir, add the garlic and butter. Stir-fry for 1 more minute.
Final umami. Add the soy sauce (just a little!), balsamic/lemon, and pepper. Toss in the herbs and serve.

items.name: Cabbage Wraps with Peppers and Olives
items.description: A delicious recipe for cabbage wraps filled with peppers and olives.

recipeIngredients.display: Herbs to taste (oregano, thyme, or bay leaf)

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the cabbage
Separate the large leaves of the savoy cabbage. Cook in salted water for 2–3 minutes, just until they become pliable. Remove and place in cold water. Drain well.

In a frying pan, heat the olive oil. Sauté the onion until soft. Add the garlic and the peppers in strips and sauté until soft, but still colourful. Add the olives, season with salt, pepper, paprika, and herbs. Turn off the heat.
Open a cabbage leaf, place a portion of filling in the centre. Fold the sides and roll like a parcel. Secure with toothpick or twine.
In the pan: Place the wraps, drizzle with olive oil and a little water or broth. Cover and cook for 10–15 minutes on low heat.
In the oven: Place in a baking dish, drizzle with olive oil, cover with aluminium foil and bake at 180°C for 20 minutes.

items.name: Sautéed Leek with Hot Spices (Mediterranean Style)
items.description: Without sauces, without frying — the flavour comes from the spices.

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the leek into fine slices and wash well.
Heat the olive oil in a large frying pan over medium heat.
Add the leek and salt; let it sweat for 4–5 minutes.
Sprinkle the spices and mix well to release the aroma.
Cook for another 3–4 minutes until soft and golden.
Remove from the heat, add the lemon and fresh herb.

items.name: Pork Neck Chops with Portuguese-Style Tomato (Classic)
items.description: A classic Portuguese recipe featuring pork neck chops cooked with tomato and spices.

recipeIngredients.display: 400 grams peeled tomato or ripe tomato, chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Season the chops with salt, pepper, and garlic.
Brown them in a large frying pan with olive oil. Remove and set aside.
In the same fat, sauté the onion and bay leaf.
Add the tomato and white wine. Let it simmer for 10 minutes.
Return the chops, cover and cook on a low heat for 20-25 minutes.
Finish with parsley or coriander.

items.name: Sautéed Broccoli with Butter and Garlic (Option 3)
items.description: A simple and tasty dish of sautéed broccoli with butter and garlic, perfect as a side dish.

recipeIngredients.display: A little lemon or vinegar (optional, but recommended)

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the broccoli. Separate the florets and cut the stems into thin slices. Steam or boil in hot water for 2–3 minutes until bright green and just tender. Drain well.
Melt the butter. In a large frying pan, over medium heat, melt the butter without letting it burn.
Sauté the garlic. Add the garlic and stir for a few seconds, just until fragrant.
Sauté the broccoli. Add the broccoli to the pan, mix well, and lightly brown for 2–4 minutes.
Finish. Adjust the salt, add the pepper if desired, and finish with a few drops of lemon or vinegar. Serve immediately.

items.name: Mushrooms in Butter with Garlic Paste
items.description: A delicious recipe for cooking mushrooms with garlic paste in butter.

recipeIngredients.display: ¹/₂ teaspoon garlic paste for every 250-300g of mushrooms (it is stronger than fresh garlic)

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the mushrooms. Clean with paper towel and cut (small or coarsely sliced).
Heat the pan. Medium-high heat. Add 1 drizzle of olive oil and 1 tablespoon of butter.
Brown the mushrooms first. Add the mushrooms and do not stir for 2-3 minutes until well browned. Turn and brown the other side.

Garlic paste time (be careful here). Lower the heat to medium. Move the mushrooms to the side of the pan and add the garlic paste in the free space. Sauté for 10-20 seconds, just until fragrant (do not let it darken).
Mix and season. Mix everything, add salt and pepper to taste.
Finish. Turn off the heat and add herbs (parsley, thyme, rosemary).

items.name: Rojões à Moda do Minho (traditional)
items.description: Traditional pork dish from the Minho region.

recipeIngredients.display: 1 kilogram rojões pork meat in medium cubes, preferably from the leg or shoulder
1 teaspoon cumin optional, but very typical
Salt and black pepper to taste
Lard (or olive oil, but lard is best here)

recipeInstructions.text: Marinate the meat
Place the rojões in a bowl with garlic, bay leaves, white wine, paprika, cumin, salt, and pepper. Mix well and let it marinate for at least 2 hours (ideally overnight).
Fry the rojões
In a large pan, melt a good spoonful of lard. Add the drained meat (reserve the marinade) and fry over medium-high heat until golden brown on the outside.
Cook internally
Once browned, add the reserved marinade. Lower the heat, cover, and let it cook for 20–30 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the meat is tender and juicy.
Potatoes
Fry the small potatoes in hot oil until golden. Reserve.

items.name: Savoy Cabbage with Black Beans
items.description: A delicious and hearty dish combining savoy cabbage and black beans, perfect for a family meal.

recipeIngredients.display: ¹/₂ savoy cabbage medium, cut into strips
2 cups black beans with some broth
Water or vegetable stock as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a pan with the olive oil, add the onion and let it sauté until soft.
Add the garlic and bay leaf, stir for a few seconds until fragrant.
Add the savoy cabbage, season with salt and pepper, and let it 'wilt' a little, stirring.
Add the black beans with some broth and the paprika.
If necessary, add a little water or stock to prevent drying.
Cover and cook on medium heat for about 20-25 minutes, until the cabbage is very tender.
Adjust the seasoning, remove the bay leaf, and it's ready.

items.name: Hake with Sautéed Tomato and Olives
items.description: A delicious hake dish prepared with sautéed tomatoes and olives.

recipeIngredients.display: 1 large ripe tomato or 1/2 cup canned tomato, drained
Black or green olives in slices

recipeInstructions.text: Season the hake with salt and pepper.
Heat a frying pan with 1 tbsp olive oil and brown the hake for 2–3 minutes on each side. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, add the remaining olive oil and garlic.
Add the cubed tomato (or canned tomato) and sauté for 2–3 minutes until the acidity reduces.
Add the olives and oregano.
Return the hake to the pan, coat with the sauce and let it simmer for 1 minute.

items.name: Wok of Savoy Cabbage, Leek and Red Pepper

recipeIngredients.display: ¹/₂ savoy cabbage cut into thin strips
2 tablespoons olive oils or sesame oil for an Asian touch
1 tablespoon soy sauce optional, but recommended
A dash of lemon juice or rice vinegar at the end

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the wok well on high heat. When hot, add the oil.
Quickly sauté the garlic (10–15 seconds, just until fragrant).
Add the leek and stir well for 1–2 minutes until it starts to soften but is still firm.
Add the red pepper and sauté for 1 more minute.
Add the Savoy cabbage, mix everything and let it cook for 3–4 minutes, stirring constantly. The idea is to have it cooked but still crunchy.
Season with soy sauce, pepper and chilli. Taste before adding salt.
Turn off the heat and finish with a few drops of lemon juice or rice vinegar to add freshness.

items.name: Oven-baked Vegetables with Spices
items.description: A healthy dish rich in fibre, vitamins, and antioxidants, with a Nutri-Score of A.

recipeIngredients.display: Optional: garlic powder, cumin, dried herbs (thyme or oregano)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 200°C.
Wash the vegetables well.
Cut the savoy cabbage into medium strips, leek into thick slices, and red pepper into strips.
Place everything on a baking tray.
Add olive oil, spices, pepper, and a pinch of salt.
Mix well with hands or a spoon to combine everything.
Bake for 25–30 minutes, stirring halfway.
Remove when the vegetables are soft and slightly golden at the edges.

items.name: Portuguese-style Heart Cabbage (Simple)
items.description: A simple and delicious preparation of heart cabbage, cooked in the Portuguese style.

recipeInstructions.text: Sauté onion and garlic, add finely chopped cabbage, season, and let stew with a little water.

items.name: Simple Baked Aubergine
items.description: A simple and delicious oven-baked aubergine recipe.

recipeIngredients.display: garlic powders minced, or 1 clove of, optional

recipeInstructions.text: Wash the aubergine and cut it into slices or strips.
Place on a baking tray lined with parchment paper.
Drizzle with a little olive oil.
Season with salt, pepper, and any spices you like.
Bake at 200°C for about 20-25 minutes, turning halfway through, until tender and golden.

recipeIngredients.display: 1 can canned chickpea or 250 g dry, soaked and cooked
1 clove garlic minced or garlic powder
piri-piri chilli flakes Optional, for spice

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 200°C.
Drain and dry the chickpeas well (the drier they are, the crunchier they'll be).
In a bowl, mix the chickpeas with olive oil, garlic, paprika, cumin, salt, pepper, and chilli (if using).
Spread the chickpeas on a baking tray lined with baking paper in a single layer.
Bake for 25–30 minutes, stirring halfway through, until golden and crispy.
Allow to cool slightly before serving (they become even crunchier as they cool).
